Description: Round-topped limestone stela depicting a mother(seated) and daughter(standing) on either side of a piled table; five columns of Hieroglyphic text and two wedjat-eyes above.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1925 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 7. (Pl.14)
Parkinson 1999 / Cracking Codes: The Rosetta Stone and Decipherment (fig. 27)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1995 Feb-May, Atlanta, Emory University, Reflections of Women in the New Kingdom 1997 May-Oct, Museum of St.Albans, Ancient Egypt
Additional IDs: Other BM number: EA216 (original Big Number)
